intro: Schizodium obtusatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf Schizodium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and small, compound leaves with a serrated margin. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Schizodium obtusatum is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
